Are you sure that you want to use JUnit for this?  This sounds like a 
job for Fit/Fitnesse.

www.fitnesse.org

Chaudhary, Harsh wrote:
>
> Hi all,
> I am writing tests for a project and I need help on something. I will
> try to be as brief as possible.
>
> I have about 100 excel spreadsheets that I am accessing via POI. These
> basically form the input to my system. Then I take this input and run it
> against a component to get some rates. The aim of my test is to compare
> the output coming from the rate engine to the output generated by
> formulas on each Excel workbook.
>
> If I run tests on all 100 workbooks at once, it takes a long time. And
> it takes longer to identify which workbooks have errors on them and why.
> So, I would like to selectively run tests on some workbooks only at a
> time. One way to do this is to write a Base Test Class which contains
> all the test methods and 100 Test classes (each corresponding to one
> workbook) which extend this class. Then these 100 classes are added to a
> suite and I can then run each test class independently.
>
> The problem is writing the 100 classes. Also, its hard to go on creating
> more classes if we need to test more workbooks.
>
> My question is, is there a way to programatically run tests on a
> workbook by passing in the name of the workbook. So that, for example, I
> can pass in the name of the Workbook and test would run for only that
> workbook.
>
> I did some research and it seems like a concept of a Plugggable Selector
> might do the trick for me. Its available at:
> http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/cookstour/cookstour.htm 
> <http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/cookstour/cookstour.htm>
>
> But I don't know this for sure. Has anyone done this before or have any
> idea how to do it?
>
> Thanks,
> Harsh.
